intro: Hildaea parvispiculata, commonly known as the small-spined hildaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico, typically found in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, spiny leaves and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It grows as a low-growing shrub, often forming dense mats on rocky soils. Hildaea parvispiculata is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
